Ah. A Mythic Rare. Again.  
Seems like Magic jumped the shark. "Mythic Rare" is such a stupid phrase. Seriously, this is why no one who has graduated from middle school plays Yu-Gi-Oh. Just get back to making rares the rarest, like any sane game-making company would, please.

posts.post_content: AT WORST, it's a 4-mana counter that gets around [Great Sable Stag](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Great Sable Stag). At best, you can make your friend want to kill himself after he FINALLY gets the legendary 6-card Cascade chain. I love thinking about a few years from now, when people have forgotten about traps, playing this in a casual game and completely warping an entire game.

Posted By: ratchet1215 (9/25/2009 12:48:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: One of the best uses for this is where another player has some sort of game ending combo that needs to go off, or a first turn combo chain and you just exile it for 0 mana. Pretty confident wizards just added this because of so many people finding out ways to instantly win the game on turn 3 or whatever with some long combo chain no one had ever thought of before. Great card, even if you play it for 4 its better than a last word or most other 4 mana cost counter spells, except that it also exiles them so they can't be played or returned from the graveyard.

Posted By: Riale (9/29/2009 8:16:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
For the most part this will function as a [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) that costs 2UU. It does get around spells that can't be countered, but it seems unlikely to actually hit more than 1 spell since they would all have to be on the stack simultaneously. Still, it can counter a 3rd spell for 0 mana.
  
   
It can be very useful vs Cascade though.
posts.html:

It can be very useful vs Cascade though.
